intro: Caiophora aconquijae, commonly known as the Aconquija caiophora, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers and palmate leaves. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
